text: is the name for the earthly remains of a castle structure in Sakaide, Kagawa, Japan. Kiyama has been designated as being of national significance. ==History== Kiyama was built by Yamato court. Following the defeat of Yamato Japan in the 663 battle of Hakusukinoe by an alliance of Tang China and the Korean kingdom of Silla, Emperor Tenji ordered the construction of defenses against a possible invasion. There are little remains of the castle on the present day site, just some Stone walls and earthworks. == Access == Kamogawa Station (Yosan Line) ==Gallery== File:Mount Ki (Kagawa), zenkei.jpg|Kiyama Kiyama Castle (Sanuki), Sekirui.jpg|Stone wall of Kiyama Kiyama Castle (Sanuki), Suimon.jpg|Water gate ==See also== *List of Historic Sites of Japan (Kagawa) ==References== Category:Castles in Kagawa Prefecture Category:Historic Sites of Japan Category:Former castles in Japan Category:Ruined castles in Japan
